intro: Suaeda corniculata subsp. corniculata, commonly known as sea spurge, is a halophytic shrub adapted to saline and arid environments. It typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and saline soils, demonstrating a high tolerance for salt and drought. The plant has small, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss, and its yellow flowers are borne in dense clusters. It produces small, round, red or orange berries that are dispersed by wind and water. This species plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various wildlife.
